dublin_core.dcvalue: Personal Digital Assistants PDAs are a readily accessible source of information to aid in the delivery of patient care A pilot group of five Family Nurse Practitioner students used PDAs to organize data and access information relevant to patient care Utilization of the PDAs in the clinical setting provided practice guidelines textbook information and protocols that were readily accessible The PDA made it possible for students to utilize preexisting knowledge with additional learning resources The PDAs were purchased with funds provided from a United States Department of Health and Human Services Health Resources and Services Administration HRSA grant
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T15:53:03Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2006-09-04
The ABNF journal : official journal of the Association of Black Nursing Faculty in Higher Education, Inc
Family nurse practitioner students utilization of Personal Digital Assistants (PDAs): implications for practice.
